query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Già era dritta in sù la fiamma e queta 2 per non dir più, e già da noi sen gia 3 con la licenza del dolce poeta,
query.error: **English:** 1 Already the flame was erect and tranquil, 2 to say no more, and already it was departing from us 3 with the permission of the gentle poet,
query.result: 1 Adhunā dṛḍhā utthitā ca śikhā ca śāntā ca, 2 adhikaṃ na vaktavyaṃ, adhunā ca asmāt gata eva, 3 madhura-kavi-anujñayā,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 quand’ un’altra, che dietro a lei venìa, 5 ne fece volger li occhi a la sua cima 6 per un confuso suon che fuor n’uscia.
query.error: **English:** 4 when another, which was coming behind it, 5 made us turn our eyes to its summit 6 because of a confused sound that was issuing forth from it.
query.result: 4 yadā aparā, yā tasyāḥ paścāt āgacchati sma, 5 asmān kṛtvā cakṣuṣī tāṃ śikhāṃ prati, 6 miśrita-śabdena yaḥ tasmāt niḥsṛtaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 Come ’l bue cicilian che mugghiò prima 8 col pianto di colui, e ciò fu dritto, 9 che l’avea temperato con sua lima,
query.error: **English:** 7 Like the Sicilian bull that bellowed first 8 with the cries of the one who made it, and rightly so, 9 for he had tempered it with his file,
query.result: 7 Yathā sicilianaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ mugdhvā prathamam 8 tasya kṛtau ruditena, yad api nyāyyam āsīt, 9 yasya svakārśaneṇa śāṇitaḥ āsīt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 mugghiava con la voce de l’afflitto, 11 sì che, con tutto che fosse di rame, 12 pur el pareva dal dolor trafitto;
query.error: **English:** 10 it bellowed with the voice of the afflicted, 11 so that, even though it was made of brass, 12 it still seemed pierced by pain;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 così, per non aver via né forame 14 dal principio nel foco, in suo linguaggio 15 si convertïan le parole grame.
query.error: **English:** 13 thus, for lack of a way or opening 14 from the beginning in the fire, in their own language 15 the woeful words were transformed.
query.result: 13 evam eva, na kadācit api mārgaḥ na api vidvaraḥ āsīt 14 ārabdhāt eva agnau, tasya svabhāṣayā 15 parivartante sma duḥkhāni vacāṁsi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Ma poscia ch’ebber colto lor vïaggio 17 su per la punta, dandole quel guizzo 18 che dato avea la lingua in lor passaggio,
query.error: **English:** 16 But after they had taken their journey 17 up over the cliff, giving it the jolt 18 that the tongue had given them in passing,
query.result: 16 Atha paścāt tadā teṣāṃ yātrāṃ gṛhītvā 17 ūrdhvaṃ śikhare, dadatāṃ tasmai kampanaṃ 18 yat dattavān āsa jihvā tayāṃ gatāvau,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 udimmo dire: «O tu a cu’ io drizzo 20 la voce e che parlavi mo lombardo, 21 dicendo “Istra ten va, più non t’adizzo”,
query.error: **English:** 19 we heard a voice say: "O you to whom I address 20 my voice, and who just now spoke Lombard, 21 saying, 'Istra, go now, I won't bother you anymore',
query.result: 19 śuśrumaḥ śabdam vadantam: "He tvam yaṃ prati niyojayāmi 20 vācam mama yaś ca adhunā Lombard bhāṣayā abhāṣathāḥ, 21 vadan 'Istra gaccha, na tvām adhikaṃ pidayāmi',

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 perch’ io sia giunto forse alquanto tardo, 23 non t’incresca restare a parlar meco; 24 vedi che non incresce a me, e ardo!
query.error: **English:** 22 even though I may have arrived somewhat late, 23 don't be annoyed to stay and talk to me; 24 see that it doesn't annoy me, and I'm burning!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Se tu pur mo in questo mondo cieco 26 caduto se’ di quella dolce terra 27 latina ond’ io mia colpa tutta reco,
query.error: **English:** 25 If you have just now fallen into this blind world 26 from that sweet Latin land from which I bear all my guilt, 27 tell me if the Romagnols have peace or war;
query.result: 25 Yadi tvam adhunāiṣaṃ jagat andham 26 patitaḥ asi tataḥ madhurāyāḥ bhūmeḥ 27 Latina yataḥ aham svaṃ sarvaṃ doṣam manye,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 dimmi se Romagnuoli han pace o guerra; 29 ch’io fui d’i monti là intra Orbino 30 e ’l giogo di che Tever si diserra».
query.error: **English:** 28 for I was from the mountains there between Urbino 29 and the ridge from which the Tiber bursts forth."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Io era in giuso ancora attento e chino, 32 quando il mio duca mi tentò di costa, 33 dicendo: «Parla tu; questi è latino».
query.error: **English:** 31 I was still downcast and attentive, 32 when my guide touched me on the side, 33 saying: "Speak, you; this man is Latin."
query.result: 31 Aham adhaḥ eva adhomukhaḥ āsam, 32 yadā mama netā mama pārśve sparśam akārṣīt, 33 vadan: "Tvam bruhi; ayam latīnaḥ asti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 E io, ch’avea già pronta la risposta, 35 sanza indugio a parlare incominciai: 36 «O anima che se’ là giù nascosta,
query.error: **English:** 34 And I, who had my answer ready, 35 began to speak without delay: 36 "O soul, who are hidden down there,
query.result: 34 Aham ca, yasya uttaraṃ siddhaṃ āsīt, 35 akāle eva vaktum ārabdhaḥ: 36 "He jīva, yaḥ adhastāt guhāyase,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Romagna tua non è, e non fu mai, 38 sanza guerra ne’ cuor de’ suoi tiranni; 39 ma ’n palese nessuna or vi lasciai.
query.error: **English:** 37 Romagna is not yours, and never was, 38 without war in the hearts of its tyrants; 39 but I left none of it openly at peace.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Ravenna sta come stata è molt’ anni: 41 l’aguglia da Polenta la si cova, 42 sì che Cervia ricuopre co’ suoi vanni.
query.error: **English:** 40 Ravenna remains as it has been for many years: 41 the eagle of Polenta broods over it, 42 so that Cervia is covered by its wings.
query.result: 40 Rāvennā tiṣṭhati yathā sthitā asti bahūn varṣān: 41 Polentasya śyenah tām ācchādayati, 42 yathā Cerviā tasyaiva pakṣayor antar bhūtvā ācchāditā asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 La terra che fé già la lunga prova 44 e di Franceschi sanguinoso mucchio, 45 sotto le branche verdi si ritrova.
query.error: **English:** 43 The land that once made the long trial 44 and of Frenchmen a bloody heap, 45 is found again beneath the green boughs.
query.result: 43 Bhūmiḥ yā cakāra pūrvaṃ dīrghaṃ parīkṣaṇam 44 Evaṃ ca Fraṃśānāṃ raktamayam rāśim, 45 Sā punaḥ prāpyate adhastāt haritaśākhānām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 E ’l mastin vecchio e ’l nuovo da Verrucchio, 47 che fecer di Montagna il mal governo, 48 là dove soglion fan d’i denti succhio.
query.error: **English:** 46 And the old and new mastiffs of Verrucchio, 47 who made Montagna suffer from bad government, 48 there where they are accustomed to, they gnash their teeth.
query.result: 46 Ca Verrucchio-nāmadheya-sthitau pūrva-apara-nāmadheyau mastyau, 47 yaḥ Montagna-nāmadheyasya dur-rājyaṃ cakratuḥ, 48 tatraiva yatra teṣāṃ abhyāsaḥ asti, danta-kṣobhaṇaṃ kurutaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Le città di Lamone e di Santerno 50 conduce il lïoncel dal nido bianco, 51 che muta parte da la state al verno.
query.error: **English:** 49 The cities of Lamone and Santerno 50 the lion cub leads from the white nest, 51 which changes place from summer to winter.
query.result: 49 Lamone ca Santerno ca nagare 50 nīyati śārdūla-bālakaḥ śveta-nīdāt, 51 yaḥ grīṣmāt hemante deśāntaram āgacchati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 E quella cu’ il Savio bagna il fianco, 53 così com’ ella sie’ tra ’l piano e ’l monte, 54 tra tirannia si vive e stato franco.
query.error: **English:** 52 And that which the Savio bathes on one side, 53 so that it lies between the plain and the mountain, 54 lives between tyranny and a free state.
query.result: 52 Sā ca yām Savyo bāhum praksālayati, 53 Tathā sāpi sthitā syāt samatala-parvatayoḥ madhye, 54 Tatra tyrājyā-svātantryayoḥ madhye jīvati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Ora chi se’, ti priego che ne conte; 56 non esser duro più ch’altri sia stato, 57 se ’l nome tuo nel mondo tegna fronte».
query.error: **English:** 55 Now who are you, I beg you to tell us; 56 do not be harder than others have been, 57 if your name holds its head high in the world."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Poscia che ’l foco alquanto ebbe rugghiato 59 al modo suo, l’aguta punta mosse 60 di qua, di là, e poi diè cotal fiato:
query.error: **English:** 58 After the fire had roared for a while 59 in its own way, it moved its sharp point 60 here and there, and then it spoke these words:
query.result: 58 Tataḥ agniḥ kañcitkālam garjitaṃ kṛtvā 59 svabhāvena svakīyaṃ tikṣṇaṃ agraṃ calayām āsa 60 iha tatra ca, tataś ca evam uktavān abhavat:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 «S’i’ credesse che mia risposta fosse 62 a persona che mai tornasse al mondo, 63 questa fiamma staria sanza più scosse;
query.error: **English:** 61 "If I believed that my answer would be 62 to someone who would ever return to the world, 63 this flame would remain still without further movement;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 ma però che già mai di questo fondo 65 non tornò vivo alcun, s’i’ odo il vero, 66 sanza tema d’infamia ti rispondo.
query.error: **English:** 64 but since no one has ever returned alive from this depth, 65 if I hear the truth, 66 I will answer you without fear of infamy.
query.result: 64 api tu yataḥ na kaścit pūrvaṃ asmāt talebhyaḥ 65 jīvan pratyāgataḥ asti, yadi śṛṇomi satyam, 66 nirbhayena apamāna-bhayāt te pratyuttaram dāsyāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 se non fosse il gran prete, a cui mal prenda!, 71 che mi rimise ne le prime colpe; 72 e come e quare, voglio che m’intenda.
query.error: **English:** 70 if it had not been for the great priest, may evil befall him!, 71 who threw me back into my former sins; 72 and how and why, I want him to understand me.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Mentre ch’io forma fui d’ossa e di polpe 74 che la madre mi diè, l’opere mie 75 non furon leonine, ma di volpe.
query.error: **English:** 73 While I was a form of bones and flesh 74 that my mother gave me, my actions 75 were not like a lion's, but like a fox's.
query.result: 73 Yāvad aham asthīnāṃ māṃsānāṃ ca rūpaṃ babhūva 74 Yāni mātā me adāt, mama karmāņi 75 Na siṃhasyeva āsīt, api tu śṛgālasye.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.error: **English:** 76 Their stratagems and covert ways 77 I knew them all, and so I plied their art, 78 that to the ends of the earth the sound went forth.
query.result: 76 Upayānāṃ ca mārgaṇānāṃ ca 77 Aham sarvān veda, evam ca taiḥ sādhakair aham vyavahāram cakāra, 78 Yathā pṛthivyāḥ ante 'pi śabdaḥ niḥsṛtaḥ.

82 ciò che pria mi piacëa, allor m’increbbe, 83 e pentuto e confesso mi rendei; 84 ahi miser lasso! e giovato sarebbe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 né sommo officio né ordini sacri 92 guardò in sé, né in me quel capestro 93 che solea fare i suoi cinti più macri.
query.error: **English:** 91 nor did he consider in himself any high office or holy orders, 92 nor in me that cord 93 that used to make his waist thinner.
query.result: 91 na ca svayam uttama-padam vā dharmya-vidhīṃ vā apaśyat, 92 na ca mama ayam śirastra-bandhaḥ, 93 yaḥ pūrvaṃ tasya kaṭi-deśam kṛśīkaroti sma.

query.prompt:

query.error: **English:** 94 But just as Constantine asked Sylvester 95 to heal him of leprosy inside the Lateran, 96 so this man asked me to be his teacher,

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 a guerir de la sua superba febbre; 98 domandommi consiglio, e io tacetti 99 perché le sue parole parver ebbre.

query.error: **English:** 100 And then he said again: “Let not your heart be troubled; 101 I absolve you now, and teach me how 102 you threw Penestrino to the ground.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 Lo ciel poss’ io serrare e diserrare, 104 come tu sai; però son due le chiavi 105 che ’l mio antecessor non ebbe care”.
query.error: **English:** 103 The heavens can I lock and unlock, 104 as you know; but there are two keys 105 that my predecessor did not care for.
query.result: 103 Dyauḥ aham samvaritum vi-varitum ca śaknomi, 104 Yathā tvam vetsi; dve ca tveṣaṇe 105 Yau pūrva-vartinaḥ na priyau āsītām.

Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 di quel peccato ov’ io mo cader deggio, 110 lunga promessa con l’attender corto 111 ti farà trïunfar ne l’alto seggio”.
query.error: **English:** 109 of that sin into which I must now fall, 110 a long promise with a short fulfillment 111 will make you triumph in the high seat.”
query.result: 109 tasmāt pāpāt yasmin aham adya patāmi, 110 dīrghaḥ pratijñāḥ kṣipraṃ sampūrṇaḥ 111 tvām jayinaṃ kariṣyati uttame āsane.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Francesco venne poi, com’ io fu’ morto, 113 per me; ma un d’i neri cherubini 114 li disse: “Non portar: non mi far torto.
query.error: **English:** 112 Francis came then, as I was dead, 113 for me; but one of the black cherubim 114 said to them: “Do not carry him: do not wrong me.
query.result: 112 Tataḥ aham mṛtaḥ sat, tadā āgataḥ āsīt Franciscus, 113 mama nimittam; tatraikaḥ kṛṣṇaḥ cherubī, 114 uvāca teṣām: “Mā enam neṣṭa, mā māṃ hiṃsīḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Venir se ne dee giù tra ’ miei meschini 116 perché diede ’l consiglio frodolente, 117 dal quale in qua stato li sono a’ crini;
query.error: **English:** 115 He must come down among my wretches 116 because he gave the fraudulent advice, 117 from which time I have been at his hair;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 ch’assolver non si può chi non si pente, 119 né pentere e volere insieme puossi 120 per la contradizion che nol consente”.
query.error: **English:** 118 for he who does not repent cannot be absolved, 119 nor can one repent and will at the same time, 120 because of the contradiction which does not allow it.”
query.result: 118 yaḥ prāyaścittaṃ na karoti sa vimuktaḥ na bhavati, 119 na ca prāyaścittaṃ kṛtvā saha eka-kāle icchā kartaṃ śakyate 120 virodhāt tena na anumataḥ.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Oh me dolente! come mi riscossi 122 quando mi prese dicendomi: “Forse 123 tu non pensavi ch’io löico fossi!”.
query.error: **English:** 121 Oh, how wretched I was! How I started 122 when she took hold of me, saying to me: “Perhaps 123 you did not think that I was a logician!”
query.result: 121 Ahaṃ duḥkhī! Katham ahaṃ samudbudhaḥ 122 Yada sā mama hastam gṛhītvā avocat: “Kim tvam na manyase mama tarkavijñānam?” 123 Tvadīyam manaḥ na manyate mama tarkavijñānam iti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 A Minòs mi portò; e quelli attorse 125 otto volte la coda al dosso duro; 126 e poi che per gran rabbia la si morse,
query.error: **English:** 124 He led me to Minos; and he, entwining 125 his tail eight times around his rigid back, 126 and after he had bitten it for great rage,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 disse: “Questi è d’i rei del foco furo”; 128 per ch’io là dove vedi son perduto, 129 e sì vestito, andando, mi rancuro».
query.error: **English:** 127 said: “This one is for the fire’s kings”; 128 wherefore I am lost there where you see, 129 and thus, clothed as you see me, I go grieving.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 Quand’ elli ebbe ’l suo dir così compiuto, 131 la fiamma dolorando si partio, 132 torcendo e dibattendo ’l corno aguto.
query.error: **English:** 130 When he had thus completed his speech, 131 the flame, grieving, departed, 132 twisting and lashing its sharp horn.
query.result: 130 Yada sa svakīyaṃ vācaṃ tathā pūrṇām akārayat, 131 jvālā duḥkhena yuktaḥ praviśati sma, 132 vaṅkaropayantī kampayantī ca śṛṅgaṃ tikṣṇam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.

query.result: 133 Vayam atimārgamāva, aham ca mama duṣṭaś ca, 134 ūrdhvaṃ śailāt yāvat paraṃ dhanuḥ, 135 yaḥ ācchādayati parikhām yasmin daṇḍaḥ prāpyate

136 a quei che scommettendo acquistan carco.
query.error: **English:** 136 who, by gambling, acquire a burden.
query.result: 136 taiḥ ye satkāryam kṛtvā bhāram āpnuvanti.
